Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 4a3160585595a672a80782a704c39fd27d4c26e0
Probably can clean up a lot of this file, but maybe you want to wait until you remove the cmake support.
Yes, I have a follow-on patch to remove CMake
Should probably use c++23 now here.
Done

.allowed is preferred over .enabled now because it covers both 'auto' and 'enabled' correctly.  You'll see some older code that does "not disabled" which was intended to do the same thing, but from before the 'allowed' function existed.
Done
'allowed'
